creator: Broughall, George, 1861-1927. (author)
Buchan, Lawrence, 1847-1909. (songs)
Gooding, H. (music)
description: Broughall, George: 1861-1927. To Manitoba to work on Manitoba Winnipeg Free Press; secretary of Manitoba Shorthand Writers Association; joined Manitoba civil service, 1883; saw service during the Rebellion as a lieutenant in 90th Battalion, 1885; returned to Ontario (Robertson, A political manual of the province of Manitoba). // Buchan, Lawrence: 1847-1909. Major in 90th "Winnipeg" Battalion of Rifles, 1885. // Gooding, H.: Bandmaster, 90th "Winnipeg" Battalion of Rifles, 1885. // Songs also by Chaplain D.M. Gordon; Sergeants. Jos. Tees and W.R. Colgate; Privates W.H. D'Arcy and R. Pomeroy. Text only; no music.

title: The 90th on active service, or, Campaigning in the North West: A musical and dramatic burlesque in two acts, with an introductory, interlude and final tableau: As played in the Princess Opera House, Winnipeg, Man., July 29th and 30th, 1885, under the patronage of His Honor the Lieut.-Governor
